author: Staff Reports sports@fosters.com
title: Diamondbacks take championship
text: Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 3:15 AM By Staff Reportssports@fosters.com Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 3:15 AM DOVER â€” The Diamondbacks recently won the Men's Baseball 25-and-over championship, beating the A's in the best-of-three World Series, two games to one. The D-backs won the decisive game, 1-0. World Series Game 1 had the Athletics making their third straight finals appearance, take an 8-3 win. Pete Jordan went the distance for the win. Jay Bernotas had four hits, and Jeff Richard and DJ Grimes two hits each to lead the offense. Game 2 was a pitchers duel between A's ace Steve Anderson and D-backs Brian Josselyn. Both went the distance with the D-backs coming away with a 2-1 victory. Game 3 had Josselyn going the distance again. This time for a 1-0 shutout and the championship. Lucas Edwards knocked in Jim Tino for the game's only run. In the semifinals, the Athletics upset the second-seeded Astros, 5-2. Anderson went the distance for the A's striking out 11 and giving up only 4 hits. Chad Averill and Kyle Faucher led the offense with two hits each. The top-seeded Diamondbacks defeated the defending champion White Sox, 8-3. Josselyn picked up the win. Edwards had three hits, while Tino and Paul Brooks had two each to lead the offense. By Staff Reports
